summary: 𝐵𝓊𝒾𝓁𝓉 𝒻𝑜𝓇 𝒮𝒾𝓃 ✉ 2 ➵pairing: minjoon x reader ➵genre: angst, eventual smut, fluff, poly!namjoon and jimin, uni!namjoon and jimin...
body:
𝐵𝓊𝒾𝓁𝓉 𝒻𝑜𝓇 𝒮𝒾𝓃 ✉ 2

➵pairing: minjoon x reader

➵genre: angst, eventual smut, fluff, poly!namjoon and jimin, uni!namjoon and jimin  

➵plot: is it worth the fight to love and be with two men?

➵ word count: 1.7k

1 2


➷➷➷

As Namjoon pulled up to your driveway you quickly undid your seatbelt trying as best as you could to exit the car before he could say anything to you. Struggling to get your door open, Namjoon reaches over to touch your knee, his plead to get you to slow down before you break the handle. You smack his hand away from you after successfully opening your door, giving him a stank face before exiting his car and slamming the door.

Perhaps you may have been a little too aggressive but what he said to you earlier, it hurt. Those words, you’ve heard them all too well. You swore that they would never hurt you. But, hearing Namjoon say it? You felt as though you would never be able to trust him again.

A little dramatic, yes, but if Namjoon was the type to get in the way or even doubt your success, then you didn’t need him. Hell, you didn’t need anyone. You’ve always been on your own. For as long as you could remember not one person was there when you needed them, your parents were always too busy to spend that much needed time with you when you were younger. You’d never blame them for that though, it was their duty to support you and themselves financially. You had just wished that they chose to have more than one child, just so that you’d have someone to lean on when needed.

You stormed into your house, kicked off your shoes and locked the door as fast you could. You just wanted this day over with.

Tomorrow will be better. Hopefully.

➷➷➷

“Rise and shine. sleepy Y/n! It’s time to wake up.” Your roommate Jin yells while pulling your covers back. Every morning before your classes Jin barges into your room to make sure you’re awake. It had become a normal custom for him after you had missed too many classes before your midterms. As much as you appreciated it, it was indeed a nuisance. Being woken up 15 minutes before your alarm was quite annoying and physically painful.

“I’m not going to class today.” You groan, pulling your covers back over your body, this time to hide your face as well so Jin wouldn’t be able to see how puffy your face was from crying all night.

It was a coward move to miss class over a stupid argument but, Namjoon was your ride to school and practice and, you didn’t have the nerve to talk to him after yesterday. Plus, you absolutely hated public transportation so, there was that. Namjoon hadn’t bothered to text you at all last night. Were you surprised? No. But, it did add a little bit of salt to the wound. The fresh cut, widely open, newly infected wound. His ego was big, yes but, that never stopped him from apologizing to you before.

You just couldn’t help but wonder why he was angry at you last night. Obviously, it was something you did in the studio but what? Usually, he was understanding. He would opt out of jumping to conclusions and let you explain yourself. Yesterday was different though. It seemed as though he was personally offended. And that’s what’s confusing you, something, whatever you had done struck a chord with him.

You had to move on with the rest of your day, you felt. It was really the only way you’d feel somewhat okay again. Ignoring how you felt wasn’t something new to you anyways. If other people could do it without blinking an eye then why couldn’t you?

➷➷➷

Namjoon loves coming to this quaint little coffee shop. He sometimes brings books with him just to pretend he’s reading. Don’t get me wrong, Kim Namjoon is a literature freak, he absolutely adores a good book, but something about the boy behind the counter was much better than black inked words spread across thin, almost transparent white paper. He had a beautiful smile. Nothing like Namjoon had ever seen before. Namjoon caught himself falling in love with the way his eyes would crinkle and turn into a perfect crescent moon shape when he laughed.

When Jimin first started working at the cafe all Namjoon could think about was finally getting the chance to be able to properly introduce himself to him. They met each other in class so that was how he knew his name. Jimin was soft-spoken, kind and hardworking, my type, Namjoon thought. He had you, of course. Namjoon could never forget about you. He loves you but, he couldn’t help the way he felt about Jimin. Jimin was innocently cute but, had a sex appeal to him that was much different from yours. Namjoon felt as though he needed to get close to him.

And so he did, eventually. Jimin was shy at first. He only made small talk with Namjoon, but he slowly got him to open up. Jimin had an obsession with touching. It started off innocent and Namjoon tried his best not to play into it, but nonetheless, he loved every second of it. Sometimes back rubs would turn into neck kisses and so on but Namjoon made sure it didn’t get any more intimate than that.

Would he tell you about how he felt about Jimin? He wasn’t sure if he ever had the balls to do it. What he was doing was wrong, yes. Still, it wasn’t like Namjoon wanted an actual relationship with Jimin. He just needed to protect him. From what, you may ask. Well, from you. You hated Jimin and Namjoon wouldn’t be able to live with himself if you wound up hurting him. Whether it be mentally or physically.

He wanted to be with you wholeheartedly. That was why Namjoon refused to contact you at all last night. He was afraid he’d say more than he needed to. Something along the lines of ‘You only hate Jimin because he has much more potential than you.’ It wasn’t like he wanted to purposely hurt you, he’d never do that. But, Namjoon just couldn’t resist fighting for Jimin. He didn’t deserve that treatment from anyone, let alone his girlfriend. Namjoon just needed a way to stop you. Maybe he could get you to see the good in Jimin.  

Namjoon would just spend the day with Jimin and then he’d call you and apologize for what he said. Everything will fall back into place. Or so he hoped.

➷➷➷

After some persuading and ass kissing, Seokjin, your noisy roommate, finally, let you stay home from class. You were almost certain he’d drag you out of bed, wash and dress you himself but, after getting down on your knees and promising to do his share of the chores the next two weeks he finally felt as though that was enough to let you stay home.

“Wanna grab some ice cream? I’ll pay. Ya know since you’re kind enough to pick up the slack around this place.” Jin mockingly laughed. God did you hate that laugh. It was definitely nighttime fuel. But also kind of comforting in a strange way? Ice cream sounded good though. Although it was 10am, ice cream with Jin sounded quiet, comforting. “Yeah, but as long as you’re serious about paying.”

“Of course I’m serious. I know what it’s like to be a broke college student, struggling to make ends meet. Eating half cooked meals and only being able to take a shower thrice a week.” Jin dramatically places his forearm over his forehead as if he was reciting a Shakespearean tragedy. Oh, the dramatics.

“Okay,” you start, “let’s just get ice cream, shall we?”

➷➷➷

You and Seokjin haven’t lived long together, only for about a year. You had been searching for roommates before starting the new school year.

Living on campus wasn’t an option for you because you needed a place to stay that was somewhat close to your dance studio. You searched and searched through roommate finder websites until you finally stumbled upon Seokjin’s ad. He was surprisingly the only sane enough person and he seemed to not have many rules. Just stuff like sharing chores and whatnot. He’s 8 years older than you and honestly, it was a little off-putting at first but, you soon learned to love the age difference. He was like an older brother. A  less cool older brother. As much as you hated to admit it Seokjin, besides Namjoon, was one of the few people you could actually tolerate. You didn’t have very many friends. But Jin was there when you needed him. All you had to do sometimes was swallow your pride and he was there when you needed to talk. He knew about your rivalry with Jimin. He gave you as much advice as he could and you appreciated it.

Jin was great at helping you feel better. Even if he annoyed the living hell out of you sometimes, you adored him dearly.

Seokjin also had great taste in secluded cafe shops. You had never heard of this place before but Jin swore up in down they not only had the best ice cream but great lattes. You weren’t really a coffee addict but you could appreciate a great latte.

You couldn’t stop thinking of how familiar sounding the cafe’s name was. Perhaps you heard someone in a lecture talking about it. But, it wasn’t really all that close to campus so it’s not like it’d be a convenient place for students to hang out.

“What can I get you guys?” A strangely familiar voice shakes you from your thoughts. You were afraid to look up because you had a feeling just who that voice may belong to.

Fuck, you thought to yourself, that’s why I know this place. It’s where Jimin works.

“Oh yeah, we’ll share a banana split. The large size. Is there anything else you want Y/n? I said I’ll pay so-” Jin was cut off by a voice you knew all too well.

“Hey Jimine, I’m gonna head out I’ll text you later, yea?”

Finally deciding to look up, you see Namjoon looking down at you like a deer in headlights.

“Namjoon?” You gasp.

➷➷➷

to be continued…

masterlist

For as long as you could remember not one person was there when you needed them, your parents were always too busy to spend that much needed time with you when you were younger. You’d never blame them for that though, it was their duty to support you and themselves financially. You had just wished that they chose to have more than one child, just so that you’d have someone to lean on when needed.

You stormed into your house, kicked off your shoes and locked the door as fast you could. You just wanted this day over with.

Tomorrow will be better. Hopefully.

➷➷➷

“Rise and shine. sleepy Y/n! It’s time to wake up.” Your roommate Jin yells while pulling your covers back. Every morning before your classes Jin barges into your room to make sure you’re awake. It had become a normal custom for him after you had missed too many classes before your midterms. As much as you appreciated it, it was indeed a nuisance. Being woken up 15 minutes before your alarm was quite annoying and physically painful.

“I’m not going to class today.” You groan, pulling your covers back over your body, this time to hide your face as well so Jin wouldn’t be able to see how puffy your face was from crying all night.

It was a coward move to miss class over a stupid argument but, Namjoon was your ride to school and practice and, you didn’t have the nerve to talk to him after yesterday. Plus, you absolutely hated public transportation so, there was that. Namjoon hadn’t bothered to text you at all last night. Were you surprised? No. But, it did add a little bit of salt to the wound. The fresh cut, widely open, newly infected wound. His ego was big, yes but, that never stopped him from apologizing to you before.

You just couldn’t help but wonder why he was angry at you last night. Obviously, it was something you did in the studio but what? Usually, he was understanding. He would opt out of jumping to conclusions and let you explain yourself. Yesterday was different though. It seemed as though he was personally offended. And that’s what’s confusing you, something, whatever you had done struck a chord with him.

You had to move on with the rest of your day, you felt. It was really the only way you’d feel somewhat okay again. Ignoring how you felt wasn’t something new to you anyways. If other people could do it without blinking an eye then why couldn’t you?

➷➷➷

Namjoon loves coming to this quaint little coffee shop. He sometimes brings books with him just to pretend he’s reading. Don’t get me wrong, Kim Namjoon is a literature freak, he absolutely adores a good book, but something about the boy behind the counter was much better than black inked words spread across thin, almost transparent white paper. He had a beautiful smile. Nothing like Namjoon had ever seen before. Namjoon caught himself falling in love with the way his eyes would crinkle and turn into a perfect crescent moon shape when he laughed.

When Jimin first started working at the cafe all Namjoon could think about was finally getting the chance to be able to properly introduce himself to him. They met each other in class so that was how he knew his name. Jimin was soft-spoken, kind and hardworking, my type, Namjoon thought. He had you, of course. Namjoon could never forget about you. He loves you but, he couldn’t help the way he felt about Jimin. Jimin was innocently cute but, had a sex appeal to him that was much different from yours. Namjoon felt as though he needed to get close to him.

And so he did, eventually. Jimin was shy at first. He only made small talk with Namjoon, but he slowly got him to open up. Jimin had an obsession with touching. It started off innocent and Namjoon tried his best not to play into it, but nonetheless, he loved every second of it. Sometimes back rubs would turn into neck kisses and so on but Namjoon made sure it didn’t get any more intimate than that.

Would he tell you about how he felt about Jimin? He wasn’t sure if he ever had the balls to do it. What he was doing was wrong, yes. Still, it wasn’t like Namjoon wanted an actual relationship with Jimin. He just needed to protect him. From what, you may ask. Well, from you. You hated Jimin and Namjoon wouldn’t be able to live with himself if you wound up hurting him. Whether it be mentally or physically.

He wanted to be with you wholeheartedly. That was why Namjoon refused to contact you at all last night. He was afraid he’d say more than he needed to. Something along the lines of ‘You only hate Jimin because he has much more potential than you.’ It wasn’t like he wanted to purposely hurt you, he’d never do that. But, Namjoon just couldn’t resist fighting for Jimin. He didn’t deserve that treatment from anyone, let alone his girlfriend. Namjoon just needed a way to stop you. Maybe he could get you to see the good in Jimin.  

Namjoon would just spend the day with Jimin and then he’d call you and apologize for what he said. Everything will fall back into place. Or so he hoped.

➷➷➷

After some persuading and ass kissing, Seokjin, your noisy roommate, finally, let you stay home from class. You were almost certain he’d drag you out of bed, wash and dress you himself but, after getting down on your knees and promising to do his share of the chores the next two weeks he finally felt as though that was enough to let you stay home.

“Wanna grab some ice cream? I’ll pay. Ya know since you’re kind enough to pick up the slack around this place.” Jin mockingly laughed. God did you hate that laugh. It was definitely nighttime fuel. But also kind of comforting in a strange way? Ice cream sounded good though. Although it was 10am, ice cream with Jin sounded quiet, comforting. “Yeah, but as long as you’re serious about paying.”

“Of course I’m serious. I know what it’s like to be a broke college student, struggling to make ends meet. Eating half cooked meals and only being able to take a shower thrice a week.” Jin dramatically places his forearm over his forehead as if he was reciting a Shakespearean tragedy. Oh, the dramatics.

“Okay,” you start, “let’s just get ice cream, shall we?”

➷➷➷

You and Seokjin haven’t lived long together, only for about a year. You had been searching for roommates before starting the new school year.

Living on campus wasn’t an option for you because you needed a place to stay that was somewhat close to your dance studio. You searched and searched through roommate finder websites until you finally stumbled upon Seokjin’s ad. He was surprisingly the only sane enough person and he seemed to not have many rules. Just stuff like sharing chores and whatnot. He’s 8 years older than you and honestly, it was a little off-putting at first but, you soon learned to love the age difference. He was like an older brother. A  less cool older brother. As much as you hated to admit it Seokjin, besides Namjoon, was one of the few people you could actually tolerate. You didn’t have very many friends. But Jin was there when you needed him. All you had to do sometimes was swallow your pride and he was there when you needed to talk. He knew about your rivalry with Jimin. He gave you as much advice as he could and you appreciated it.

Jin was great at helping you feel better. Even if he annoyed the living hell out of you sometimes, you adored him dearly.

Seokjin also had great taste in secluded cafe shops. You had never heard of this place before but Jin swore up in down they not only had the best ice cream but great lattes. You weren’t really a coffee addict but you could appreciate a great latte.

You couldn’t stop thinking of how familiar sounding the cafe’s name was. Perhaps you heard someone in a lecture talking about it. But, it wasn’t really all that close to campus so it’s not like it’d be a convenient place for students to hang out.

“What can I get you guys?” A strangely familiar voice shakes you from your thoughts. You were afraid to look up because you had a feeling just who that voice may belong to.

Fuck, you thought to yourself, that’s why I know this place. It’s where Jimin works.

“Oh yeah, we’ll share a banana split. The large size. Is there anything else you want Y/n? I said I’ll pay so-” Jin was cut off by a voice you knew all too well.

“Hey Jimine, I’m gonna head out I’ll text you later, yea?”

Finally deciding to look up, you see Namjoon looking down at you like a deer in headlights.

“Namjoon?” You gasp.

➷➷➷

to be continued…

title: Perspective
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2M7gxOK

by serendipity_Vkook

Yoongi likes Jungkook.
Jungkook likes Yoongi.
Namjoon doesn’t think they are functional humans.
Hoseok just Knows.
Jin is amused by the situation.
Jimin just wants to convince Taehyung that YoonKook is real.
Everyone wants Yoongi and Jungkook to just talk about it.
It all comes down to words but Jungkook and Yoongi do things differently.

summary: Imagine you being best friends with bts in high school and you've had a crush on jungkook since forever, but he doesn't notice...
body: Imagine you being best friends with bts in high school and you’ve had a crush on jungkook since forever, but he doesn’t notice it and falls in love with another girl. Then one day your school is doing a talent school and you’re singing “hate u love u” to jungkook in front of the whole school.
